title: Structural Engineer Manager
jobDescription:
Hi,


Please find below the roles and responsibilities of Manager/Sr Manager - Structural Engineer


Role & responsibilities


Structural Engineer with experience in offshore Oil & Gas/ FPSO Topside projects covering Feed, basic and detail design. This covers newbuilds & conversion.


Key responsibilities


Demonstrated hands on working knowledge of structural engineering related to offshore/oil and Gas industry, main ones as listed below.


FEED, detail design and management of structural engineering activities for new build offshore/oil and gas and FPSO conversion projects. Preparing design documents and drawings for submission to classification society and client.



Perform structural strength assessment using Finite Element analysis.


Experience in various structural design standards like API/DIN/JIS as well as a good understanding of ABS, DNV, API, AISC and other related industry regulations and standards.


Support project tenders by estimating and preparing MTO.


Key competencies


Expertise in software such as : DNV-GL SESAM Genie, STAAD Pro, Strand7 & SACS.


Experience in Project Planning and reporting


Should have excellent communication skill.


Qualifications


Minimum Bachelor's Degree in Structural Engineering


If anyone is interested, please share your resume on moumita.po@peoplefy.com

title: Senior Engineer-Network and Security For Quatrro/Mumbai_Night Shift
tagsAndSkills: SDWAN,L3,PCNSE,Velo cloud & Cisco Meraki,Cisco Meraki,VMware,Cisco ACS,L2

placeholders.label: Hybrid - Navi Mumbai, Thane, Mumbai (All Areas)

jobDescription:
Role & responsibilities

Essential functions and responsibilities (but not limited to):

  • Create presentations outlining findings and present to the client managers and

engineers.

  • Switching technology VLAN, VXLAN, VTP, VSS – Cisco Catalyst platform, Nexus, HP

and Juniper, SDLAN

  • Routing – Routing protocols, configuration and Troubleshooting traditional WAN and

SDWAN – Velo cloud & Cisco Meraki

  • Firewalls – Sound knowledge on Virtual firewalls, Cisco ASA, Checkpoint, Palo Alto NG

firewalls.

  • Sound Knowledge on Wireless technology
  • Basic understanding on Link load balancers, Server Load balancers and Data Center

device management & implementation.

  • Work with clients to develop network engineering solutions from concept through

implementation.

  • Assist in development of network detailed designs in the following areas: software

defined networking, network segmentation, network access control, network security

and cloud networking components.

  • Analyze and provide recommendations for emerging network technologies.
  • Understanding Support priorities and objectives and taking an active role in

accomplishing them.

  • Working Knowledge on Network security Protocols, LAN, WAN, Network security,

Wireless networks, DHCP, DNS, Proxy, VPN, Firewalls, TCP/IP, Intranets, Extranets,

VoIP, Virtualization, High Availability, Backups/Disaster recovery, Routers, Device drivers.

  • Deployment and configuration of various network devices and services, including SD-

WAN, Load Balancers, Routers, Switches, IPS/IDS, Wireless LAN, VPN, MPLS, Radius,

and MFA.

  • Providing Level 2/Level 3 support and troubleshooting to resolve issues.
  • Providing Support to Level 1 and Level 2 Engineers.
  • Handling Customer escalations and taking ownerships.
  • Providing RCA and Cases analysis whenever required.
  • Preparing Weekly, Monthly, Quarterly reports and share with the Upper management

and Clients.

  • Knowledge of Managing Virtual networks on cloud platforms e.g., Azure, Google Cloud,

AWS and VM Ware.

  • Performing network maintenance and system upgrades including service packs, patches,

hot fixed and security configurations.


  • Monitoring performance and ensured system availability and reliability.
  • Monitoring system resource utilization, trending, and capacity planning.
  • Managing and configuring Network devices via SNMP via RMM tools e.g., N-Central N-

able, ConnectWise, PRTG etc.

  • Exposure with popular tools to troubleshoot the complex issues in Networks e.g., PSping,

Telnet, traceroute, network watcher, Wireshark, Fidler etc.

  • Providing Level 2 support and troubleshooting to resolve issues.
  • Working within established configuration and change management policies to ensure

awareness, approval and success of changes made to the network infrastructure.

  • Responsible to Create SOPs for Different solutions to help Tier 1 and Tier 2 Team members.
  • Will be responsible for updating, sharing daily, weekly & monthly tickets tracker &

analysis.

  • Defining key management routines and governance strategy to ensure effective

business process execution.

  • Initiate improvements in tools, requirements gathering, processes, and people.

Knowledge and Skills

Educational Qualifications:

  • Should be Graduate or Above.
  • Certifications desirable – CCNP, PCNSE, Check Point certified

Work Experience:

  • Should have worked as a Senior Network Engineer Level 3 and understand design aspects
  • Should at least have 7 to 12 years of total working experience in related field.

Other Prerequisites:

  • Ability to work is rotational shift & depending on business needs.
  • Prior work experience in MNC & matrix organization.

Preferred candidate profile



Perks and benefits

title: Purchase Manager
tagsAndSkills: Store Supervision,GRN,Store Operations,managing the store,The Purchase Manager will be responsible for overseeing the procurement of goods and services,Inventory Control,Stock Taking,Material Requirement Planning
jobDescription:
Position: Purchase Manager
Location: Training Ship Rehaman , Nhava , Navi Mumbai , India
Department: Procurement & Stores
Reporting To: CHRO/CFO
Staff Reporting: 1

Organization Overview:

Training Ship Rehaman is a prominent Nautical Educational Institution which caters to Nautical and Hospitality Management. It also has a School with a junior college at Nhava sprawling over a 23-acre campus. We cater to over 700 students and 200 residential staff with families at the college and 1200 students at the CBSE school. Our infrastructure includes specialized departments such as Maintenance (Civil Works, Electricals, Air Conditioning, Carpentry, Upholstery, Plumbing), Security, Housekeeping , Laundry , IT and Farm. We are committed to providing a well-maintained and resourceful environment for both educational and residential purposes.

Role Overview:

The Purchase Manager will be responsible for overseeing the procurement of goods and services, managing the store, and ensuring that all departments have the necessary resources to perform their duties without interruptions. This role involves coordinating with various departments to anticipate their needs and ensuring timely and cost-effective procurement of items. The Purchase Manager will also manage a team in the procurement and store management functions.

Key Responsibilities and Deliverables (KRAs):

  1. Procurement Management:
    • Develop and implement procurement policies and procedures in alignment with organizational goals.
    • Identify and evaluate suppliers and negotiate contracts to obtain favorable terms.
    • Ensure timely procurement of materials, equipment, and services required by different departments.
    • Schedules deliveries and ensures timely fulfilment of orders.
    • Monitor market trends and pricing to make informed purchasing decisions.
    • Maintain accurate records of purchases, pricing, and other relevant data.
  2. Store Management:
    • Oversee the daily operations of the store, including inventory management, stocking, and maintenance.
    • Ensure that the store is organized and that items are easily accessible for various departments.
    • Conduct regular ABC analysis.
    • Implement inventory control systems to track stock levels and avoid shortages or overstocking.
    • Coordinate with the Maintenance , IT and other departments to ensure that stock levels of essential items are maintained.
  3. Vendor Management:
    • Build and maintain strong relationships with vendors and suppliers.
    • Onboard new vendors with proper background verification and compliance fulfillment.
    • Evaluate vendor performance and ensure compliance with agreed-upon terms and quality standards.
    • Address and resolve any issues or discrepancies with suppliers promptly.
  4. Budget Management:
    • Assist in the preparation of the procurement budget and monitor expenditures to stay within budget limits.
    • Analyze purchasing data to identify cost-saving opportunities and recommend budget adjustments as needed.
  5. Compliance and Reporting:
    • Ensure compliance with all relevant regulations and organizational policies in procurement activities.
    • Interactions with Statutory, Internal & other Auditors and get the Audits done with respect to Purchase & Stores Function
    • Prepare and present reports on procurement activities, inventory status, and expenditure to the CHRO/CFO and Heads of the Institution.
    • Develop MIS Reports in the ERP software, Interact with Software developer for proper maintenance, and rectification of records and glitches in the system.
  6. Coordination and Communication:
    • Work closely with the departments such as Nautical, Hospitality, Maintenance, IT, Security, and Housekeeping , Transportation etc., to understand their procurement needs and ensure timely delivery of items.
    • Coordinate with other departments to resolve any issues related to procurement or inventory.
  7. Team Management:
    • Supervise and guide the procurement and store staff to ensure efficient operations and high performance.
    • Provide training and support to team members as required.

Qualifications:

  • Education, Experience, & Licensing Requirements:
  • Bachelors degree.
  • Degree in supply chain management, logistics, or business administration preferred.
  • 7-10 years’ experience as a purchasing manager.
  • Experience using procurement software and databases for stores and Inventory management.
  • Supervisory experience and IT Savvy.
  • Degree in supply chain management, logistics, or business administration

Experience: Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in procurement and store management, preferably within an educational institution or similar environment.

Skills:

  • Excellent organizational skills.
  • Effective communication skills.
  • Negotiation skills.
  • Research and analytical skills.
  • Interpersonal skills.
  • Attention to detail.

Additional Information:

  • Work Hours: Full-time, 6 Days /week with flexibility to address any procurement emergencies or urgent needs.
  • Languages: The candidate should be well versed in English, Hindi and/or other Indian languages.
  • Location: Based on the campus at Nahva, Navi Mumbai.
  • Accommodation : You have to arrange your own accommodation , Bus facility available from Ulwe – Bamandongri station (To & Fro).

Interested candidates are encouraged to submit their resume with a cover letter. The position requires short notice period and can arrange for their own accommodation nearby NHAVA / Ulwe.

Perks and benefits

rS 60,000 - 90,000 pER MONTH , Depending on qualification and relevant experience.
